bodydiv.p: The content and technology are both important features of a taxonomy that supports high-quality and consistent application of IFRS Standards and are interrelated. The IFRS Taxonomy due process is designed to protect the integrity of both its content and technology, in particular to ensure that:

li.p: does not conflict with, and does not represent an interpretation of or additional application guidance on, IFRS Standards or the Conceptual Framework; and
assists with the effective and efficient communication, dissemination and analysis of IFRS disclosures.
adheres to the specifications of the technical syntax used to deliver and express the IFRS Taxonomy content; and
reflects best practices in order to facilitate adoption by current and future users of the IFRS Taxonomy and to remain relevant and up to date.
